Package network

Class graph

java.lang.Object
network.graph
public class graph
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a network graph.
Author:
Sudesh Agrawal (sudesh@utexas.edu). Last Updated: October 19, 2020.

  • Method Details

    • initializeAsCompleteGraph

      public void initializeAsCompleteGraph​(int size, int startingNodeLabel) throws java.lang.Exception
      Initialize g, assumed to be empty, with a complete graph of given size.
      Parameters:
      size - number of vertices (nodes) in the complete graph
      startingNodeLabel - node numbering to start from.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if size<0, or if startingNodeLabel<0, or if startingNodeLabel>=size, or if vertex set of g is not empty.

    • initializeAsCirculantGraph

      public void initializeAsCirculantGraph​(int size, int[] offsets, int startingNodeLabel) throws java.lang.Exception
      Initialize an empty graph g with a circulant graph of given size.
      A circulant graph is a graph of n (= size) vertices in which the ith vertex is adjacent to the (i+j)th and the (i-j)th vertices for each j in the array offsets.
      Parameters:
      size - number of vertices (nodes) in the circulant graph
      offsets - defines the list of all distances in any edge
      startingNodeLabel - node numbering to start from.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if size<0, or if startingNodeLabel<0, or if startingNodeLabel>=size, or if vertex set of g is not empty, of if offsets has invalid values.

    • buildGraphFromFile

      public void buildGraphFromFile​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String separator) throws java.lang.Exception
      Build network from a text file. Each line in the text file is an edge, where the vertices are separated by commas.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to file to be read
      separator - character that separates source node and target node.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if vertex set of g is not empty.

    • changeGraphToLargestConnectedComponent

      public void changeGraphToLargestConnectedComponent() throws java.lang.Exception
      Changes the graph to one of its largest components.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if graph g does not have a vertex.

    • getCoreNumber

      Get the core number of node in the graph g.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • dokCoreDecomposition

      public void dokCoreDecomposition​(int k) throws java.lang.Exception
      Modifies the graph g to the largest connected component of its k-core subgraph.
      Parameters:
      k - the order of the core.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if graph contains self-loops.

    • getkCore

      public org.jgrapht.Graph<java.lang.Integer,​org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge> getkCore​(int k) throws java.lang.Exception
      Returns the k-core of g. A k-core is a maximal subgraph that contains nodes of degree k or more.
      Parameters:
      k - the order of the core.
      Returns:
      the k-core subgraph.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if graph contains self-loops.

    • getCoreNumbers

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getCoreNumbers() throws java.lang.Exception
      Returns the core number for each vertex. A k-core is a maximal subgraph that contains nodes (vertices) of degree k or more. The core number of a node is the largest value k of a k-core containing that node.

      References:

      [1] An O(m) Algorithm for Cores Decomposition of Networks Vladimir Batagelj and Matjaz Zaversnik, 2003. https://arxiv.org/abs/cs.DS/0310049

      [2] https://networkx.github.io/documentation/stable/_modules/networkx/algorithms/core.html#core_number

      Returns:
      the core number for each vertex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if graph contains self-loops.

    • writeNetworkInfoToCSV

      public void writeNetworkInfoToCSV​(java.lang.String filename, boolean append) throws java.lang.Exception
      Writes network information (max degree, avg. distance, etc.) to csv file.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to output file
      append - true, if you wish to append to existing file; false, otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if error in input-output operation.
